sentence: After setting record highs at the open, the major U.S. benchmark averages have moved away from their best levels of the day as Wall Street responds to Proctor & Gamble's ( PG ) decision to keep activist investor Nelson Peltz off the board, and as investors gear up for Q3 earnings and the September minutes from the Federal Open Market Committee meeting.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average is hanging onto a modest gains as a rally in shares of component stock Walmart ( WMT ) helps offset the loss in Proctor & Gamble.
Walmart shares set a new 52-week high after the retailer reiterated its upbeat 2018 EPS and revenue guidance, and announced plans to buy back $20 billion in shares.
The S&P 500 is also staying afloat on gains in the energy sector, but the Nasdaq has flipped to the negative side amid losses in the healthcare and technology sectors.
This is the second day in a row the Nasdaq has traded lower after nine straight days higher.
European stock markets are all trading in the red as investors brace for the Catalan president, Carles Puigdemont, to declare the region's independence from Spain at 1:00pm ET.
Last week, 90% of Catalonians voted to leave Spain, triggering the country's worst constitution crisis in nearly 40 years.
Led by gains in the financial sector, the UK's FTSE-100 closed higher after Credit Suisse upgraded both Royal Bank of Scotland ( RBS ) and Lloyds Banking Group ( LYG ).
Additionally, the crisis in Spain is encouraging investors to pivot out of EU bourses into the relative safe-haven of the UK.
Crude oil was up $1.34 to $50.92 per barrel.
Natural gas was up $0.05 to $2.88 per 1 million BTU.
Gold was up $8.50 to $1,293.40 an ounce, while silver was up $0.21 to $17.18 an ounce.
Copper was up $0.03 to $3.06 per pound.
Among energy ETFs, the United States Oil Fund was up 2.85% to $10.28 with the United States Natural Gas Fund was up 1.46% to $6.26.
Amongst precious-metal funds, the Market Vectors Gold Miners ETF was up 0.22% to 23.74 while SPDR Gold Shares were up 0.44% to $122.62.
The iShares Silver Trust was up 1.03% to $16.18.

Here's where the markets stand at mid-day:

NYSE Composite Index was up 38.12 points (+0.31%) to 12,332.07

Dow Jones Industrial Index was up 27.81 points (+0.02%) to 2,545.22

S&P 500 was up 0.40 points (+0.02%) to 2,545.31

Nasdaq Composite Index was down 14.57 points (-0.22%) to 6,565.32

FTSE 100 was up 39.38 points (+0.40%) to 7,538.27

DAX was down 27.15 points (-0.21%) to 12,949.25

CAC 40 was down 2.18 points (-0.04%) to 5,363.65

Nikkei 225 was up 132.80 points (+0.64%) to 20,823.51

Hang Seng Index was up 164.24 points (+0.58%) to 28,490.83

Shanghai China Composite Index was up 9.16 points (+0.27%) to 3,383.54

NYSE Energy Sector Index was up 85.45 points (+0.79%) to 10,929.80

NYSE Financial Sector Index was up 21.96 points (+0.28%) to 7,868.85

NYSE Healthcare Sector Index was down 13.81 points (-0.10%) to 14,039.44

(+) ROKA (+150.62%) A2A Pharmaceuticals may be making an acquisition play
